H0.text: In the human body, which pigment is primarily responsible for the colour of skin. Eumelanin-like compound

H1.text: In the human body, which pigment is primarily responsible for the colour of skin. Carotene

H2.text: In the human body, which pigment is primarily responsible for the colour of skin. Bilirubin

H3.text: In the human body, which pigment is primarily responsible for the colour of skin. Melanin

A4.text: In humans, melanin is the primary determinant of skin color.

A5.text: The human epidermis contains approximately 74% eumelanin and 26% pheomelanin, largely irrespective of skin tone.
